author: Albert Einstein
quote: If you can't explain it simply, you don't understand it well enough.

author: Pablo Picasso
quote: Every child is an artist. The problem is how to remain an artist once we grow up.

author: Walt Disney
quote: If you can dream it you can do it!

author: Coco Chanel
quote: There are people who have money and people who are rich.

author: Coco Chanel
quote: Since everything is in our heads, we had better not lose them.

author: Mark Twain
quote: The two most important days in your life are the day you were born and the day you figure out why.

author: Steve Jobs
quote: The ones who are crazy enough to think that they can change the world, are the ones who do.

author: John Lennon
quote: Everything will be okay in the end. If it's not okay, it's not the end.

author: Hypatia
quote: Reserve your right to think, for even to think wrongly is better than not to think at all.

author: Socrates
quote: Strong minds discuss ideas, average minds discuss events, weak minds discuss people.

author: Ernest Hemingway
quote: The best way to find out if you can trust somebody is to trust them.

author: Lewis Carroll
quote: Imagination is the only weapon in the war against reality.

author: Isaac Newton
quote: We build too many walls and not enough bridges.

author: Leo Tolstoy
quote: Everyone thinks of changing the world, but no one thinks of changing himself.

author: Thomas Edison
quote: I have not failed. I've just found 10,000 ways that won't work.

author: Thomas Edison
quote: The greatest invention in the world is the mind of a child.

author: Elon Musk
quote: I think it is possible for ordinary people to choose to be extraordinary.

author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery
quote: The time for action is now. It's never too late to do something.

author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery
quote: All qrown-ups were once children... but only few of them remember it.

author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery
quote: I know but one freedom and that is the freedom of the mind.

author: Winston Churchill
quote: Continuous efforts - not strength or intelligence - is the key to unlocking our potential.

author: Winston Churchill
quote: Attitude is a little thing that makes a big difference.

author: Margaret Thatcher
quote: Being powerful is like being a lady. If you have to tell people you are, you aren't.

author: Robert Louis Stevenson
quote: A friend is a present you give to yourself.

author: Robert Louis Stevenson
quote: You can give without loving, but you can never love without giving.

author: Erich Maria Remarque
quote: Dark times always reveal good people.

author: Sigmund Freud
quote: The only person with whom you have to compare yourself is you in the past.

author: Chuck Palahniuk
quote: We all die. The goal isn't to live forever, the goal is to create something that will.

author: Charles Dickens
quote: If there were no bad people, there would be no good lawyers.

author: Leonardo Da Vinci
quote: Learning never exhausts the mind.

author: Leonardo Da Vinci
quote: As you cannot do what you want, want what you can do.

author: Leonardo Da Vinci
quote: Simplicity is the ultimate sophistication.

author: Plato
quote: Thinking: the talking of the soul with itself.

author: Mark Twain
quote: Don't let schooling interfere with your education.

author: Edgar Allan Poe
quote: The scariest monsters are ones that lurk within our souls...

author: Edgar Allan Poe
quote: Words have no power to impress the mind without the exquisite horror of their reality...

author: Edith Piaf
quote: Every damn thing you do in this life, you have to pay for.

author: Oscar Wilde
quote: Be yourself. Everyone else is taken.

author: Oscar Wilde
quote: Nowadays people know the price of everything and the value of nothing.

author: Albert Einstein
quote: Everybody is a genius. But if you judge a fish by its ability to climb a tree it will live its whole life beliving that it is stupid.

author: Albert Einstein
quote: Two things are infinite: the universe and human stupidity; and I'm not so sure about the universe.

author: Anton Chekhov
quote: Knowledge is of no value unless you put it into practice.

author: Anton Chekhov
quote: Man is what he believes.

author: Socrates
quote: An honest man is always a child.

author: Richard Bach
quote: You are always free to change your mind and choose a different future, or a different past.

author: Seneca
quote: He is most powerful who has power over himself.

author: Agatha Christie
quote: Very few of us are what we seem.

author: Jane Austen
quote: It isn't what we say or think that defines us, but what we do.

author: Stephen Hawking
quote: However difficult life may seem, there is always something you can do and succeed at.

author: Stephen Hawking
quote: Work gives you meaning and purpose and life is empty without it.

author: Stephen Hawking
quote: Intelligence is the ability to adapt to change.
